trans-unit.source: How a Machine Learning model progresses from an experiment to an operationalized web service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How a Machine Learning model progresses from an experiment to an operationalized web service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: An overview of the mechanics of how your Azure Machine Learning model progresses from a development experiment to an operationalized web service.
trans-unit.target: An overview of the mechanics of how your Azure Machine Learning model progresses from a development experiment to an operationalized web service.

trans-unit.source: How a Machine Learning model progresses from an experiment to an operationalized web service
trans-unit.target: How a Machine Learning model progresses from an experiment to an operationalized web service

trans-unit.source: An ***experiment*** is a canvas in Azure Machine Learning Studio that allows you to interactively develop, run, test, and iterate as you create a predictive analysis model.
trans-unit.target: An ***experiment*** is a canvas in Azure Machine Learning Studio that allows you to interactively develop, run, test, and iterate as you create a predictive analysis model.

trans-unit.source: A wide variety of modules are available that you can use to bring data into your experiment, manipulate the data, train a model using machine learning algorithms, score the model, evaluate the results, and output final values.
trans-unit.target: A wide variety of modules are available that you can use to bring data into your experiment, manipulate the data, train a model using machine learning algorithms, score the model, evaluate the results, and output final values.

trans-unit.source: Once you’re satisfied with your experiment, you can deploy it as an ***Azure web service*** so that users can send it new data and receive back results.
trans-unit.target: Once you’re satisfied with your experiment, you can deploy it as an ***Azure web service*** so that users can send it new data and receive back results.

trans-unit.source: In this article we’ll give an overview of the mechanics of how your
trans-unit.target: In this article we’ll give an overview of the mechanics of how your

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning model progresses from a development experiment to an
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning model progresses from a development experiment to an

trans-unit.source: operationalized web service.
trans-unit.target: operationalized web service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] There are other ways to develop and deploy machine learning models, but this article is focused on how you use Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] There are other ways to develop and deploy machine learning models, but this article is focused on how you use Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: For a discussion of how to create a predictive web service with R, see the blog post [Build & Deploy Predictive Web Apps Using RStudio and Azure ML](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2015/09/25/build-and-deploy-a-predictive-web-app-using-rstudio-and-azure-ml.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For a discussion of how to create a predictive web service with R, see the blog post [Build & Deploy Predictive Web Apps Using RStudio and Azure ML](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2015/09/25/build-and-deploy-a-predictive-web-app-using-rstudio-and-azure-ml.aspx).

trans-unit.source: While Azure Machine Learning Studio is designed primarily to help you develop and deploy a *predictive analysis model*, it’s possible to use Studio to develop an experiment that doesn’t include a predictive analysis model.
trans-unit.target: While Azure Machine Learning Studio is designed primarily to help you develop and deploy a *predictive analysis model*, it’s possible to use Studio to develop an experiment that doesn’t include a predictive analysis model.

trans-unit.source: For example, an experiment might just input data, manipulate it, and then output the results.
trans-unit.target: For example, an experiment might just input data, manipulate it, and then output the results.

trans-unit.source: Just like a predictive analysis experiment, you can deploy this non-predictive experiment as a web service, but it’s a simpler process because the experiment isn’t training or scoring a machine learning model.
trans-unit.target: Just like a predictive analysis experiment, you can deploy this non-predictive experiment as a web service, but it’s a simpler process because the experiment isn’t training or scoring a machine learning model.

trans-unit.source: While that’s not the typical use of Studio, we’ll include it in the discussion below so that we can give a complete explanation of how Studio works.
trans-unit.target: While that’s not the typical use of Studio, we’ll include it in the discussion below so that we can give a complete explanation of how Studio works.

trans-unit.source: Developing and deploying a predictive web service
trans-unit.target: Developing and deploying a predictive web service

trans-unit.source: Here are the stages that a typical solution follows as you develop and
trans-unit.target: Here are the stages that a typical solution follows as you develop and

trans-unit.source: deploy it using Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: deploy it using Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: *Figure 1 - Stages of a typical predictive analysis model*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 1 - Stages of a typical predictive analysis model*

trans-unit.source: The training experiment
trans-unit.target: The training experiment

trans-unit.source: The ***training experiment*** is the initial experiment canvas in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: The ***training experiment*** is the initial experiment canvas in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: The purpose of the training experiment is to give you a place to develop, test, iterate, and eventually train a machine learning model.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of the training experiment is to give you a place to develop, test, iterate, and eventually train a machine learning model.

trans-unit.source: You can even train multiple models simultaneously as you look for the best solution, but once you’re done experimenting you’ll select a single trained model and eliminate the rest from the experiment.
trans-unit.target: You can even train multiple models simultaneously as you look for the best solution, but once you’re done experimenting you’ll select a single trained model and eliminate the rest from the experiment.

trans-unit.source: For an example of developing a predictive analysis experiment, see [Develop a predictive analytics solution for credit risk assessment in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution.md).
trans-unit.target: For an example of developing a predictive analysis experiment, see [Develop a predictive analytics solution for credit risk assessment in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution.md).

trans-unit.source: The predictive experiment
trans-unit.target: The predictive experiment

trans-unit.source: Once you have a trained model in your training experiment, you click **Set Up Web Service** in Machine Learning Studio and Studio goes through the process of converting your training experiment to a ***predictive experiment***.
trans-unit.target: Once you have a trained model in your training experiment, you click **Set Up Web Service** in Machine Learning Studio and Studio goes through the process of converting your training experiment to a ***predictive experiment***.

trans-unit.source: The purpose of the predictive experiment is to use your trained model to score new data, with the goal of eventually becoming operationalized as an Azure web service.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of the predictive experiment is to use your trained model to score new data, with the goal of eventually becoming operationalized as an Azure web service.

trans-unit.source: This conversion is done for you through the following steps:
trans-unit.target: This conversion is done for you through the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Convert the set of modules used for training into a single module and save it as a trained model
trans-unit.target: Convert the set of modules used for training into a single module and save it as a trained model

trans-unit.source: Eliminate any extraneous modules not related to scoring
trans-unit.target: Eliminate any extraneous modules not related to scoring

trans-unit.source: Add input and output ports that the eventual web service will use
trans-unit.target: Add input and output ports that the eventual web service will use

trans-unit.source: There may be more changes you want to make to get your predictive
trans-unit.target: There may be more changes you want to make to get your predictive

trans-unit.source: experiment ready to deploy as a web service.
trans-unit.target: experiment ready to deploy as a web service.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want

trans-unit.source: the web service to output only a subset of results, you can add a
trans-unit.target: the web service to output only a subset of results, you can add a

trans-unit.source: filtering module before the output port.
trans-unit.target: filtering module before the output port.

trans-unit.source: In this conversion process the training experiment is not discarded.
trans-unit.target: In this conversion process the training experiment is not discarded.

trans-unit.source: When the process is complete you’ll have two tabs in Studio: one for the
trans-unit.target: When the process is complete you’ll have two tabs in Studio: one for the

trans-unit.source: training experiment and one for the predictive experiment.
trans-unit.target: training experiment and one for the predictive experiment.

trans-unit.source: This way,
trans-unit.target: This way,

trans-unit.source: before you deploy your web service, you can make changes to the training
trans-unit.target: before you deploy your web service, you can make changes to the training

trans-unit.source: experiment and rebuild the predictive experiment.
trans-unit.target: experiment and rebuild the predictive experiment.

trans-unit.source: Or you can save a copy
trans-unit.target: Or you can save a copy

trans-unit.source: of the training experiment to start another line of experimentation.
trans-unit.target: of the training experiment to start another line of experimentation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you click **Set Up Web Service** you start an automatic process to convert your training experiment to a predictive experiment, and this works well in most cases.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you click **Set Up Web Service** you start an automatic process to convert your training experiment to a predictive experiment, and this works well in most cases.

trans-unit.source: But if your training experiment is complex (for example, you have multiple paths for training that you join together), you might prefer to do this conversion manually.
trans-unit.target: But if your training experiment is complex (for example, you have multiple paths for training that you join together), you might prefer to do this conversion manually.

trans-unit.source: For more details on how this conversion process works, see [Convert a Machine
trans-unit.target: For more details on how this conversion process works, see [Convert a Machine

trans-unit.source: Learning training experiment to a predictive
trans-unit.target: Learning training experiment to a predictive

trans-unit.source: experiment](machine-learning-convert-training-experiment-to-scoring-experiment.md).
trans-unit.target: experiment](machine-learning-convert-training-experiment-to-scoring-experiment.md).

trans-unit.source: The web service
trans-unit.target: The web service

trans-unit.source: Once you’re satisfied that your predictive experiment is ready, you click **Deploy Web Service** to operationalize your model by deploying it as an ***Azure web service***.
trans-unit.target: Once you’re satisfied that your predictive experiment is ready, you click **Deploy Web Service** to operationalize your model by deploying it as an ***Azure web service***.

trans-unit.source: Users can now send data to your model using the web service REST API and receive back the results.
trans-unit.target: Users can now send data to your model using the web service REST API and receive back the results.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to do this, see [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been deployed from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to do this, see [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been deployed from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).

trans-unit.target: Once you deploy the web service, the predictive experiment and web

trans-unit.source: service remain connected, and you can go back-and-forth between them:
trans-unit.target: service remain connected, and you can go back-and-forth between them:

trans-unit.source: The non-typical case: creating a non-predictive web service
trans-unit.target: The non-typical case: creating a non-predictive web service

trans-unit.source: If your experiment does not train a predictive analysis model, then you
trans-unit.target: If your experiment does not train a predictive analysis model, then you

trans-unit.source: don’t need to create both a training experiment and a scoring experiment - there’s
trans-unit.target: don’t need to create both a training experiment and a scoring experiment - there’s

trans-unit.source: just one experiment, and you can deploy it as a web service
trans-unit.target: just one experiment, and you can deploy it as a web service

trans-unit.source: (Machine Learning Studio detects whether your experiment contains a
trans-unit.target: (Machine Learning Studio detects whether your experiment contains a

trans-unit.source: predictive model by analyzing the modules you’ve used).
trans-unit.target: predictive model by analyzing the modules you’ve used).

trans-unit.source: After you’ve iterated on your experiment and are satisfied with it:
trans-unit.target: After you’ve iterated on your experiment and are satisfied with it:

trans-unit.source: Click **Set Up Web Service** - input and output nodes are added automatically
trans-unit.target: Click **Set Up Web Service** - input and output nodes are added automatically

trans-unit.source: Click **Run**
trans-unit.target: Click **Run**

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy Web Service**
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Your web service is now deployed, and you can access and manage it just
trans-unit.target: Your web service is now deployed, and you can access and manage it just

trans-unit.source: like a predictive web service.
trans-unit.target: like a predictive web service.

trans-unit.source: The web service buttons
trans-unit.target: The web service buttons

trans-unit.source: In Machine Learning Studio, the web service buttons - **Set Up Web Service** and **Deploy Web Service** - change name and function depending on where you’re at in the development process.
trans-unit.target: In Machine Learning Studio, the web service buttons - **Set Up Web Service** and **Deploy Web Service** - change name and function depending on where you’re at in the development process.

trans-unit.source: **Experiment contains a predictive model**
trans-unit.target: **Experiment contains a predictive model**

trans-unit.source: If the experiment trains and scores a predictive model, then the web
trans-unit.target: If the experiment trains and scores a predictive model, then the web

trans-unit.source: service buttons perform these functions:
trans-unit.target: service buttons perform these functions:

trans-unit.source: **Type of experiment**
trans-unit.target: **Type of experiment**

trans-unit.source: **Button**
trans-unit.target: **Button**

trans-unit.source: **What it does**
trans-unit.target: **What it does**

trans-unit.source: Experiment under development
trans-unit.target: Experiment under development

trans-unit.source: **Set Up Web Service**
trans-unit.target: **Set Up Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Gives two options
trans-unit.target: Gives two options

trans-unit.source: - **Predictive Web Service**
trans-unit.target: - **Predictive Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Converts the experiment into both a training experiment and a scoring experiment
trans-unit.target: Converts the experiment into both a training experiment and a scoring experiment

trans-unit.source: - **Retraining Web Service**
trans-unit.target: - **Retraining Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Converts the experiment into a retraining experiment (see the "Updating" section below)
trans-unit.target: Converts the experiment into a retraining experiment (see the "Updating" section below)

trans-unit.source: Training experiment
trans-unit.target: Training experiment

trans-unit.source: **Set Up Web Service**
trans-unit.target: **Set Up Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Gives two options
trans-unit.target: Gives two options

trans-unit.source: - **Update Predictive Experiment**
trans-unit.target: - **Update Predictive Experiment**

trans-unit.source: Updates the associated predictive experiment with changes you’ve made to the training experiment
trans-unit.target: Updates the associated predictive experiment with changes you’ve made to the training experiment

trans-unit.source: - **Retraining Web Service**
trans-unit.target: - **Retraining Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Converts the training experiment into a retraining experiment (see the "Updating" section below)
trans-unit.target: Converts the training experiment into a retraining experiment (see the "Updating" section below)

trans-unit.source: -*or*- **Deploy Web Service**
trans-unit.target: -*or*- **Deploy Web Service**

trans-unit.source: If you have set up the retraining experiment for deployment, then this deploys it as a web service
trans-unit.target: If you have set up the retraining experiment for deployment, then this deploys it as a web service

trans-unit.target: Predictive experiment

trans-unit.source: **Deploy Web Service**
trans-unit.target: **Deploy Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Deploys the predictive experiment as a web service
trans-unit.target: Deploys the predictive experiment as a web service

trans-unit.target: **Experiment does *not* contain a predictive model**

trans-unit.target: If the experiment does not train and score a predictive model, then the

trans-unit.target: web service buttons are much simpler:

trans-unit.source: **Set Up Web Service**
trans-unit.target: **Set Up Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Prepares the experiment for deploying as a web service
trans-unit.target: Prepares the experiment for deploying as a web service

trans-unit.source: Experiment prepared for deployment
trans-unit.target: Experiment prepared for deployment

trans-unit.source: **Deploy Web Service**
trans-unit.target: **Deploy Web Service**

trans-unit.source: Deploys the experiment as a web service, opens web service configuration page
trans-unit.target: Deploys the experiment as a web service, opens web service configuration page

trans-unit.source: Updating your web service
trans-unit.target: Updating your web service

trans-unit.source: Now that you’ve deployed your experiment as a web service, what if you
trans-unit.target: Now that you’ve deployed your experiment as a web service, what if you

trans-unit.source: need to update it?
trans-unit.target: need to update it?

trans-unit.source: That depends on what you need to update:
trans-unit.target: That depends on what you need to update:

trans-unit.source: **You want to change the input or output, or you want to modify how the web service manipulates data**
trans-unit.target: **You want to change the input or output, or you want to modify how the web service manipulates data**

trans-unit.source: If you’re not changing the model but are just changing how the web service handles data, you can edit the predictive experiment and then click **Deploy Web Service** again.
trans-unit.target: If you’re not changing the model but are just changing how the web service handles data, you can edit the predictive experiment and then click **Deploy Web Service** again.

trans-unit.source: The web service will be stopped, the updated predictive experiment will be deployed, and the web service will start up again.
trans-unit.target: The web service will be stopped, the updated predictive experiment will be deployed, and the web service will start up again.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example: Suppose your predictive experiment returns the entire row of input data with the predicted result.
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example: Suppose your predictive experiment returns the entire row of input data with the predicted result.

trans-unit.source: You may decide that you want the web service to just return the result.
trans-unit.target: You may decide that you want the web service to just return the result.

trans-unit.source: So you can add a **Project Columns** module in the predictive experiment, right before the output port, to exclude columns other than the result.
trans-unit.target: So you can add a **Project Columns** module in the predictive experiment, right before the output port, to exclude columns other than the result.

trans-unit.source: When you click **Deploy Web Service** again, the web service is updated.
trans-unit.target: When you click **Deploy Web Service** again, the web service is updated.

trans-unit.source: **You want to retrain the model with new data**
trans-unit.target: **You want to retrain the model with new data**

trans-unit.source: If you want to keep your machine learning model, but you would like to
trans-unit.target: If you want to keep your machine learning model, but you would like to

trans-unit.source: retrain it with new data, you have two choices:
trans-unit.target: retrain it with new data, you have two choices:

trans-unit.source: **Retrain the model while the web service is running** - If you want to retrain your model while the predictive web service is running, you can do this by making a couple modifications to the training experiment to make it a ***retraining experiment***, then you can deploy it as a ***retraining web* service**.
trans-unit.target: **Retrain the model while the web service is running** - If you want to retrain your model while the predictive web service is running, you can do this by making a couple modifications to the training experiment to make it a ***retraining experiment***, then you can deploy it as a ***retraining web* service**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to do this, see [Retrain Machine Learning models programmatically](machine-learning-retrain-models-programmatically.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to do this, see [Retrain Machine Learning models programmatically](machine-learning-retrain-models-programmatically.md).

trans-unit.source: **Go back to the original training experiment and use different training data to develop your model** - Your predictive experiment is linked to the web service, but the training experiment is not directly linked in this way.
trans-unit.target: **Go back to the original training experiment and use different training data to develop your model** - Your predictive experiment is linked to the web service, but the training experiment is not directly linked in this way.

trans-unit.source: If you modify the original training experiment and click **Set Up Web Service**, it will create a *new* predictive experiment which, when deployed, will create a *new* web service.
trans-unit.target: If you modify the original training experiment and click **Set Up Web Service**, it will create a *new* predictive experiment which, when deployed, will create a *new* web service.

trans-unit.source: It doesn’t just update the original web service.
trans-unit.target: It doesn’t just update the original web service.

trans-unit.source: So if you need to modify the training experiment, open it and click **Save As** to make a copy.
trans-unit.target: So if you need to modify the training experiment, open it and click **Save As** to make a copy.

trans-unit.source: This will leave intact the original training experiment, predictive experiment, and web service.
trans-unit.target: This will leave intact the original training experiment, predictive experiment, and web service.

trans-unit.source: You can now create a new web service with your changes.
trans-unit.target: You can now create a new web service with your changes.

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve deployed the new web service you can then decide whether to stop the previous web service or keep it running alongside the new one.
trans-unit.target: Once you’ve deployed the new web service you can then decide whether to stop the previous web service or keep it running alongside the new one.

trans-unit.source: **You want to train a different model**
trans-unit.target: **You want to train a different model**

trans-unit.source: If you want to make changes to your original predictive experiment, such as selecting a different machine learning algorithm, trying a different training method, etc., then you need to follow the second procedure described above for retraining your model: open the training experiment, click **Save As** to make a copy, and then start down the new path of developing your model, creating the predictive experiment, and deploying the web service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to make changes to your original predictive experiment, such as selecting a different machine learning algorithm, trying a different training method, etc., then you need to follow the second procedure described above for retraining your model: open the training experiment, click **Save As** to make a copy, and then start down the new path of developing your model, creating the predictive experiment, and deploying the web service.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new web service unrelated to the original one - you can decide which one, or both, to keep running.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new web service unrelated to the original one - you can decide which one, or both, to keep running.

trans-unit.target: retraining the model - [Retrain Machine Learning models programmatically](machine-learning-retrain-models-programmatically.md)
